total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 1s in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 8s in the input grid.
Q4: Create a new grid with the same dimensions as the input grid.
Q5: Fill in the new grid with the values from the cells identified in Q1, Q2, and Q3.
Q6: For the cells that are not filled in Q5, fill them with 0s in the new grid.
Q1: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 3s in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 8s in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 1s in the input grid.
Q4: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 7s in the input grid.
Q5: For each cell identified in Q1, replace the cell value with the value of the cell to its immediate right.
Q6: For each cell identified in Q2, replace the cell value with the value of the cell to its immediate left.
Q7: For each cell identified in Q3, replace the cell value with the value of the cell above it.
Q8: For each cell identified in Q4, replace the cell value with the value of the cell below it.
Q9: For all other cells, replace the cell value with 0.

Q2: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 8s in the input grid.
Q3: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 1s in the input grid.
Q4: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 7s in the input grid.
Q5: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 2s in the input grid.
Q6: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 9s in the input grid.
Q7: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 4s in the input grid.
Q8: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 5s in the input grid.
Q9: Identify the cells that are surrounded by 6s in the input grid.
Q10: For each cell identified in the previous steps, replace the cell value with the number of surrounding cells of the same value.
Q11: Create a new grid that only includes the cells identified and replaced in the previous steps, maintaining their relative positions.
